question: Highly mechanized farming led which of the following European countries to become second largest farm exporter in world (after US)?
explanation: Highly Scientific development and highly mechanised farming is a feature of Dutch agricultural sector, which has strong focus on international exports. It employs about 4% of the Dutch labour force but produces large surpluses in the food-processing industry and accounts for 21 percent of the Dutch total export value. Due to this, Netherlands ranked first in the European Union and second worldwide in value of agricultural exports, behind only the United States.
